info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 12 at 9:40PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...VIRGA SHOWERS WITH STRONG MICROBURST WINDS WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF EAST CENTRAL SAN MIGUEL, QUAY AND NORTHEASTERN CURRY COUNTIES THROUGH 1045 PM MDT... At 937 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking virga showers with strong microburst winds along a line extending from near Tucumcari to near Glenrio. Movement was northeast at 20 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts around 55 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Quay, Tucumcari, Logan, San Jon, Grady, Ragland, Glenrio, Ute Lake State Park, Broadview and Wheatland. This includes the following highways... Interstate 40 between Mile Markers 327 and 373. State Road 104 between Mile Markers 101 and 105. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If threatening weather approaches your area, take shelter in a sturdy building. Blowing dust associated with strong microburst winds can reduce visibilities below one quarter mile at times.
